message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms presented suggest that the girl may have autism spectrum disorder. We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described in the case are consistent with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), which has a higher incidence in boys than girls, with a ratio of about 4:1. Option B is not correct as there is no evidence of a link between maternal age and ASD. Option C is also not correct as there is no consistent evidence of a link between maternal smoking and ASD. Option D is partially correct, as some studies have shown an association between low prenatal maternal serum vitamin D levels and ASD, but further research is needed to confirm this link.
